Other Information.Additional Info: The microporous nature of TpPa-1 acts as a barrier to lithium polysulfides while allowing Li+ ion transport.

Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Effectively blocks polysulfide crossover while maintaining Li+ ion transport.

Other Information.Additional Info: TpPa-1 exhibits weak interaction energies with Li2S (-0.73 eV) and Li2S4 (-0.53 eV), confirming its role as a physical barrier rather than a strong chemical adsorbent.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Combined chemical adsorption and physical sieving

Other Information.Additional Info: The TpPa-1 shell prevents direct contact between lithium polysulfides and the Co/Ti-NC core during solution-based tests. However, in battery operation, lithium polysulfides are confined within the core where they are chemically adsorbed and catalytically converted.

Sieving Mechanism: Combined chemical adsorption and physical sieving

Experimental Validation.Method: Adsorption tests, CV, LSV, and battery cycling performance
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Initial specific capacity: 1135 mAh g−1 at 0.2 C; Capacity retention: 600 mAh g−1 after 500 cycles at 1 C.

Other Information.Additional Info: The Co/Ti-NC core provides strong chemical affinity for lithium polysulfides, while the TpPa-1 shell physically restricts their diffusion out of the material.
